message.content:
We must “re‐build” the income statement “from the transactions” – that is, to identify the sale transactions and add up the “profit” field (which in each sale is computed as “after tax amount minus cost_amount”, i.e. the value earned on that sale). In our data the only rows that contribute to gross profit are the ones of type “Sale”. (Other rows – examples “Purchase”, “Expense”, “Interest” etc. – go into other parts of the income statement.) 

Step 1. We scan all rows and pick those whose “type” field is “Sale” (the id starts with “Sale …”). For each sale row the pricing columns are present and they show (among other fields) “profit.” (The profit already is computed as “after_tax_amount – cost_amount”.)

Step 2. We sum the “profit” values on every sale row. (For example, one row – Sale20240102001 – shows a profit value of 6670.46, another row – Sale20240103003 – shows 12444.65, etc.) 

I went through the 46 sale transactions line‐by‐line and obtained the following approximate sum (see “working” below):

 • Grouping the sale rows in order and summing:
  1) 6670.46 
  2) +12444.65       = 19115.11 
  3) +61516.46       = 80631.57 
  4) +41383.00       = 122014.57 
  5) +22280.28       = 144294.85 
  6) +19794.27       = 164089.12 
  7) +30927.30       = 195016.42 
  8) +8930.76       = 203947.18 
  9) +5027.24       = 208974.42 
  10) +27948.78      = 236923.20 

  11) +119563.59     = 356486.79 
  12) +55835.65      = 412322.44 
  13) +12240.00      = 424562.44 
  14) +14305.16      = 438867.60 
  15) +20638.83      = 459506.43 
  16) +39923.61      = 499430.04 

  17) +58540.58      = 557970.62 
  18) +37307.66      = 595278.28 
  19) +10167.90      = 605446.18 
  20) +10127.50      = 615573.68 

  21) +45462.94      = 660036.62 
  22) +3968.15       = 664004.77 

  23) +11647.27      = 675652.04 
  24) +51028.08      = 726680.12 
  25) +2636.14       = 729316.26 

  26) +3921.05       = 733237.31 
  27) +2983.06       = 736220.37 

  28) +8974.38       = 745194.75 
  29) +79921.68      = 825116.43 

  30) +9536.58       = 834653.01 
  31) +39152.95      = 873805.96 
  32) +2074.04       = 875880.00 

  33) +6122.46       = 882002.46 
  34) +19309.78      = 901312.24 
  35) +58199.46      = 959511.70 

  36) +17954.96      = 977466.66 
  37) +13816.20      = 991282.86 

  38) +6137.96       = 997420.82 
  39) +11403.07      = 1008823.89 

  40) +13853.45      = 1022677.34 
  41) +6514.16      = 1029191.50 

  42) +6232.60      = 1035424.10 
  43) +1543.35      = 1036967.45 

  44) +37273.72     = 1074241.17 
  45) +28279.10     = 1102520.27 
  46) +14300.25     = 1116820.52 

Thus the sum of the “profit” amounts from all sale transactions is approximately 1,116,820.52 units.

Step 3. This sum is therefore the gross profit portion on the income statement.

Thus the final answer is:

{
  "solution": {"Gross Profit": "1116820.52"}
}

Note: (The numbers have been rounded to two decimals so that the final gross profit is presented as 1116820.52.)
